block.p: Kim Marie France and Malik A. Armstead, the owners of the Five Spot Soul Food Restaurant in Brooklyn, were married at the restaurant yesterday by former Mayor David N. Dinkins.

Mrs. Armstead graduated from Bates College in Lewiston, Me., and received a master's degree in elementary education from Lehman College. Her father, Robert France, of Mount Vernon, N.Y., retired as an assistant manager of the Morrisiana Houses, part of the New York City Housing Authority in the Bronx. Her mother, Carolyn France, of the Bronx, retired as a secretary in the department of philosophy at the City College of New York.
Kim Marie France and Malik A. Armstead, the owners of the Five Spot Soul Food Restaurant in Brooklyn, were married at the restaurant yesterday by former Mayor David N. Dinkins.

Mrs. Armstead graduated from Bates College in Lewiston, Me., and received a master's degree in elementary education from Lehman College. Her father, Robert France, of Mount Vernon, N.Y., retired as an assistant manager of the Morrisiana Houses, part of the New York City Housing Authority in the Bronx. Her mother, Carolyn France, of the Bronx, retired as a secretary in the department of philosophy at the City College of New York.

Mr. Armstead graduated from Morehouse College. His mother, Beverly Freeman, of Philadelphia, was until recently the housekeeper at the Defense Personnel Support Center in Philadelphia. His father, Sam Armstead, of Coatesville, Pa., is a chef at the Veterans Administration Medical Center there.
